entry.title: You're a Computer Athlete (Cortex Futura)
entry.content:
Article: Productivity

You're a Computer Athlete

You're likely a professional computer user – you should behave like the athlete that you are

entry.title: Using Tana's Supertags with Search (Cortex Futura)
entry.content:
Article: Tana

Using Tana's Supertags with Search

Learn how to use Tana's supertags with live searches and create amazing workflows.

entry.title: Learn how to use Supertags in Tana (Cortex Futura)
entry.content:
Article: Tana

Learn how to use Supertags in Tana

Understand the basics of how to use Tana's supertags.

entry.title: Using Tana's Live Search Feature (Cortex Futura)
entry.content:
Article: Tana

Using Tana's Live Search Feature

Learn how to use Tana's live searches.

entry.title: Get oriented in Tana's UI (Cortex Futura)
entry.content:
Article: Tana

Get oriented in Tana's UI

Get started with Tana by exploring its main UI and navigation features.

entry.title: Everything is a Node in Tana (Cortex Futura)
entry.content:
Article: Tana

Everything is a Node in Tana

Learn how to use Tana's nodes.

entry.title: Data About Nodes - Fields and Tags in Tana (Cortex Futura)
entry.content:
Article: Tana

Data About Nodes - Fields and Tags in Tana

Learn how to leverage Tana's fields and tags to record data about individual nodes.

entry.title: New Time Units for Higher Productivity (Cortex Futura)
entry.content:
Article: Productivity

New Time Units for Higher Productivity

Our common measures of time never worked for me for time management. So I invented my own.

entry.title: The Input Channel Audit (Cortex Futura)
entry.content:
Atomic Essay: Attention Design

The Input Channel Audit

A quick How To guide for shaping your information diet

entry.title: Develop Strong Criteria for Input Triage (Cortex Futura)
entry.content:
Atomic Essay: Attention Design

Develop Strong Criteria for Input Triage

'How in the world. You need less Twitter in your life.' I had, again, discarded my guard rails of attention design and failed at input triage.

entry.title: The Seven Questions At The Heart Of Knowledge Ops (Cortex Futura)
entry.content:
Article: Knowledge Ops

The Seven Questions At The Heart Of Knowledge Ops

Personal Knowledge Management is too restrictive – you want to think about all seven of these questions instead.

entry.title: The Grazing – Feeding Model of Information Gathering (Cortex Futura)
entry.content:
Article: Knowledge Ops

The Grazing – Feeding Model of Information Gathering

On the Internet, information is limitless. The Grazing-Feeding Model of Information Gathering helps you know how you're engaging with that information.

entry.title: Sadly, Constraints Are Real (Cortex Futura)
entry.content:
Atomic Essay: Constraints

Sadly, Constraints Are Real

For the last 15 years I've ignored one fundamental truth: real constraints exist. Here's what I'm trying now.

entry.title: Adversarial Reading (Cortex Futura)
entry.content:
Article: Algorithm of Thought

Adversarial Reading

Bullshit is everywhere, and these algorithms of thought help you do more adversarial reading.

entry.title: How to improve a process (Cortex Futura)
entry.content:
Atomic Essay: Productivity

How to improve a process

With taking notes as an example, let's talk about how to improve any process.

entry.title: Don't Fiddle With Your Note-Taking System (Cortex Futura)
entry.content:
Atomic Essay: Note-taking

Don't Fiddle With Your Note-Taking System

You should stick to one note-taking system and fiddle with it as little as possible. That's a myth.

entry.title: Get Rid of Peer Review and Academic Journals (Cortex Futura)
entry.content:
Article: Peer Review

Get Rid of Peer Review and Academic Journals

Why to get rid of peer review and academic journals as we know them – and possibly what to do instead.

entry.title: You Actually Need to Context Switch (Cortex Futura)
entry.content:
Atomic Essay: Productivity

You Actually Need to Context Switch

Common wisdom says that you need to avoid context switching. That's only half true – sometimes you need to context switch.

entry.title: How to Context Switch Like a Pro (Cortex Futura)
entry.content:
Article: Productivity

How to Context Switch Like a Pro

Context switching is unavoidable – but you can make it less costly by combining a couple of simple strategies.

entry.title: A Tale of Two Biases: How To Read The News (Cortex Futura)
entry.content:
Article: Reading

A Tale of Two Biases: How To Read The News

Counter two frequent biases while reading the news: Selection Bias and Description Bias.

entry.title: How to use Roam Research for Interstitial Journaling (Cortex Futura)
entry.content:
Article: Interstitial Journaling

How to use Roam Research for Interstitial Journaling

Interstitial Journaling is a great technique for minimizing context switching costs and staying productive. Here's how I use it in Roam Reserch.

entry.title: Why You Should Pick Zotero As A Reference Manager (Cortex Futura)
entry.content:
Article: Academic Workflow

Why You Should Pick Zotero As A Reference Manager

A guide to reference managers, what you should expect from them and why Zotero is the reference manager you should use - whether you're in academia or not.

entry.title: Behavior First, Theory Second (Cortex Futura)
entry.content:
Article: Learning

Behavior First, Theory Second

Behavior and Theory are two heuristics that can help you in deciding between courses and teachers.

entry.title: True Algorithms of Thought Have Arrived (Cortex Futura)
entry.content:
Article: Algorithm of Thought

True Algorithms of Thought Have Arrived

Can you imagine being able to transfer 'mental software' between people? It's now possible, by using Algorithms of Thought in Roam Research.

entry.title: The Power of Keystone Habits with Roam Research (Cortex Futura)
entry.content:
Article: Programming Attention

The Power of Keystone Habits with Roam Research

How to use Roam Research as your keystone habit to regularly revisit writing that is important to you, using the ∆ feature in Roam.

entry.title: Zotero and Roam Research (Cortex Futura)
entry.content:
Article: Academic Workflow

Zotero and Roam Research

A guide for using Roam Research together with Zotero to get the most out of your citation metadata.

entry.title: A short (preliminary) guide to Spaced Repetition in Roam Research (Cortex Futura)
entry.content:
Article: Spaced Repetition

A short (preliminary) guide to Spaced Repetition in Roam Research

How to use Roam Research's new Delta feature to do Spaced Repetition and never forget anything again.

entry.title: My grandfather's research technique - Index, Proto-Zettelkasten, Paper (Cortex Futura)
entry.content:
Article: Zettelkasten

My grandfather's research technique - Index, Proto-Zettelkasten, Paper

My grandfather's way of doing history research before the computer age. Using paper and a meticulous process, he built something close to a Zettelkasten.

entry.title: How to cure Highlight Dementia (Cortex Futura)
entry.content:
Article: Reading

How to cure Highlight Dementia

How to make sure that you never lose insights when reading and highlighting. Because Highlight Dementia is completely preventable.

entry.title: Actor's Concepts and Inventing Discovery (Cortex Futura)
entry.content:
Article: Reading

Actor's Concepts and Inventing Discovery

How discovery became an actor's concept - and what you can use that for. Can you play chess without knowing that you are doing so?

entry.title: Getting Started with Algorithms of Thought (Cortex Futura)
entry.content:
Article: Reading

Getting Started with Algorithms of Thought

An introduction to Algorithms of Thought - how they differ from Mental Models and how to use them in Roam Research.

entry.title: Universal-X - Of Polymaths and other fantastic creatures (Cortex Futura)
entry.content:
Article: Polymathy

Universal-X - Of Polymaths and other fantastic creatures

There are words you can't use to describe yourself without sounding like an utter ass. Imagine asking someone at a party who they are and they respond with 'Nice to meet you, I'm a brilliant photographer/physicist/writer' - instant, life-long friends you'll be, no?

entry.title: The Right to Disagree (Cortex Futura)
entry.content:
Article: Algorithm of Thought

The Right to Disagree

Contrary to popular belief, you can't just disagree with someone because you feel like it. You have to __earn__ the right to disagree with someone's position.

entry.title: A Gruvbox Theme for Roam Research (Cortex Futura)
entry.content:
Article: Roam Research

A Gruvbox Theme for Roam Research

How to create a Gruvbox-style color theme for Roam Research using Roam's built-in CSS capabilities.

entry.title: A population of red candidate massive galaxies ~600 Myr after the Big Bang (Nature - research articles)
entry.content:
A population of red candidate massive galaxies ~600 Myr after the Big Bang

  • Ivo Labbé
  • Pieter van Dokkum
  • Bingjie Wang
Article 22 Feb 2023

entry.title: Weak upper-mantle base revealed by postseismic deformation of a deep earthquake (Nature - research articles)
entry.content:
Weak upper-mantle base revealed by postseismic deformation of a deep earthquake

The Earth’s mantle viscosity is studied following a deep earthquake located near the bottom of the upper mantle, and a weak layer is detected that is consequential to the understanding of mantle dynamics.

  • Sunyoung Park
  • Jean-Philippe Avouac
  • Adriano Gualandi
Article 22 Feb 2023

entry.title: Diagnosing destabilization risk in global land carbon sinks (Nature - research articles)
entry.content:
Diagnosing destabilization risk in global land carbon sinks

Increasing variability of net biome production over recent decades may be due to climate change and points to destabilization of the carbon–climate system.

  • Marcos Fernández-Martínez
  • Josep Peñuelas
  • Ivan A. Janssens
Article 22 Feb 2023

entry.title: Chemically defined cytokine-free expansion of human haematopoietic stem cells (Nature - research articles)
entry.content:
Chemically defined cytokine-free expansion of human haematopoietic stem cells

A culture system allows the long-term expansion of human haematopoietic stem cells (HSCs) in vivo without the use of recombinant cytokines or albumin, with potential applications for clinical therapies involving HSCs.

  • Masatoshi Sakurai
  • Kantaro Ishitsuka
  • Satoshi Yamazaki
Article 22 Feb 2023

entry.title: Four ways blue foods can help achieve food system ambitions across nations (Nature - research articles)
entry.content:
Four ways blue foods can help achieve food system ambitions across nations

A study proposes four ways in which foods sourced in aquatic environments can contribute to healthier, more environmentally sustainable and equitable food systems, and examines the relevance of these ambitions to nations.

  • Beatrice I. Crona
  • Emmy Wassénius
  • Colette C. C. Wabnitz
Article Open Access 22 Feb 2023

entry.title: The evolution of the marine carbonate factory (Nature - research articles)
entry.content:
The evolution of the marine carbonate factory

Geochemical insights from a dataset of carbonate stable strontium isotopes suggest that porewater production of authigenic carbonates may have been an overlooked carbonate sink for much of Earth’s history.

  • Jiuyuan Wang
  • Lidya G. Tarhan
  • Noah J. Planavsky
Article 22 Feb 2023

entry.title: Structure of the human DICER–pre-miRNA complex in a dicing state (Nature - research articles)
entry.content:
Structure of the human DICER–pre-miRNA complex in a dicing state

The active-state structure of human DICER bound to pre-miRNA reveals the structural basis for the specificity of DICER in how it selects substrates in a sequence dependent manner, and sheds light on DICER-related diseases.

  • Young-Yoon Lee
  • Hansol Lee
  • Soung-Hun Roh
Article 22 Feb 2023

entry.title: Optimal nitrogen rate strategy for sustainable rice production in China (Nature - research articles)
entry.content:
Optimal nitrogen rate strategy for sustainable rice production in China

A proposed optimal nitrogen rate strategy together with analysis of an extensive on-farm dataset shows that meeting national rice production targets in 2030 in China is possible while concurrently reducing nationwide nitrogen consumption.

  • Siyuan Cai
  • Xu Zhao
  • Xiaoyuan Yan
Article 22 Feb 2023

entry.title: Microbiota-derived 3-IAA influences chemotherapy efficacy in pancreatic cancer (Nature - research articles)
entry.content:
Microbiota-derived 3-IAA influences chemotherapy efficacy in pancreatic cancer

Indole-3-acetic acid (3-IAA), a tryptophan metabolite derived from the gut microbiota, is associated with a better response to chemotherapy in pancreatic ductal adenocarcinoma (PDAC), and dietary interventions could have a role in the treatment of PDAC.

  • Joseph Tintelnot
  • Yang Xu
  • Nicola Gagliani
Article Open Access 22 Feb 2023

entry.title: Atomic Bose–Einstein condensate in twisted-bilayer optical lattices (Nature - research articles)
entry.content:
Atomic Bose–Einstein condensate in twisted-bilayer optical lattices

Quantum simulation of superfluid to Mott insulator transition in twisted-bilayer square lattices based on atomic Bose–Einstein condensates loaded into spin-dependent optical lattices provides a new direction for exploring moiré physics in ultracold atoms.

  • Zengming Meng
  • Liangwei Wang
  • Jing Zhang
Article 22 Feb 2023

entry.title: Observation of hydrodynamic plasmons and energy waves in graphene (Nature - research articles)
entry.content:
Observation of hydrodynamic plasmons and energy waves in graphene

By using new on-chip terahertz spectroscopy techniques to measure the absorption spectra of a graphene microribbon as well as the energy waves close to charge neutrality, hydrodynamic collective excitations are observed.

  • Wenyu Zhao
  • Shaoxin Wang
  • Feng Wang
Article 22 Feb 2023

entry.title: The quantum twisting microscope (Nature - research articles)
entry.content:
The quantum twisting microscope

A quantum twisting microscope based on a unique van der Waals tip and capable of performing local interference experiments opens the way for new classes of experiments on quantum materials.

  • A. Inbar
  • J. Birkbeck
  • S. Ilani
Article 22 Feb 2023

entry.title: Essential elements of radical pair magnetosensitivity in Drosophila (Nature - research articles)
entry.content:
Essential elements of radical pair magnetosensitivity in Drosophila

Non-CRYPTOCHROME-dependent radical pairs can elicit responses to magnetic fields in neurons in Drosophila melanogaster.

  • Adam A. Bradlaugh
  • Giorgio Fedele
  • Richard A. Baines
Article Open Access 22 Feb 2023

entry.title: Ageing threatens sustainability of smallholder farming in China (Nature - research articles)
entry.content:
Ageing threatens sustainability of smallholder farming in China

Rural population ageing reduces the sustainability of smallholder farming in China, but the transition to a new farming model could reverse the negative effects of rural population ageing.

  • Chenchen Ren
  • Xinyue Zhou
  • Baojing Gu
Article 22 Feb 2023

entry.title: Geometric frustration of Jahn–Teller order in the infinite-layer lattice (Nature - research articles)
entry.content:
Geometric frustration of Jahn–Teller order in the infinite-layer lattice

A distorted infinite-layer lattice of single-crystal CaCoO2 originates from competition between an ordered Jahn–Teller effect and geometric frustration.

  • Woo Jin Kim
  • Michelle A. Smeaton
  • Harold Y. Hwang
Article 22 Feb 2023

entry.title: De novo design of luciferases using deep learning (Nature - research articles)
entry.content:
De novo design of luciferases using deep learning

A deep-learning-based strategy is used to design artificial luciferases that catalyse the oxidative chemiluminescence of diphenylterazine with high substrate specificity and catalytic efficiency.

  • Andy Hsien-Wei Yeh
  • Christoffer Norn
  • David Baker
Article Open Access 22 Feb 2023

entry.title: Topological spin texture in the pseudogap phase of a high-Tc superconductor (Nature - research articles)
entry.content:
Topological spin texture in the pseudogap phase of a high-Tc superconductor

Using Lorentz transmission electron microscopy, one of the first direct observations of topological spin texture is described, in the pseudogap phase of a high-temperature cuprate superconductor based on YBa2Cu3O6+x.

  • Zechao Wang
  • Ke Pei
  • Jing Zhu
Article 22 Feb 2023

entry.title: Autoimmunity in Down’s syndrome via cytokines, CD4 T cells and CD11c+ B cells (Nature - research articles)
entry.content:
Autoimmunity in Down’s syndrome via cytokines, CD4 T cells and CD11c+ B cells

An autoimmune-prone state of steady-state cytokinopathy, hyperactivated CD4 T cells and ongoing B cell activation contributes to a breach in immune tolerance in individuals with Down’s syndrome.

  • Louise Malle
  • Roosheel S. Patel
  • Dusan Bogunovic
Article 22 Feb 2023

entry.title: Suppressing quantum errors by scaling a surface code logical qubit (Nature - research articles)
entry.content:
Suppressing quantum errors by scaling a surface code logical qubit

A study demonstrating increasing error suppression with larger surface code logical qubits, implemented on a superconducting quantum processor.

  • Rajeev Acharya
  • Igor Aleiner
  • Ningfeng Zhu
Article Open Access 22 Feb 2023

entry.title: Sequence determinant of small RNA production by DICER (Nature - research articles)
entry.content:
Sequence determinant of small RNA production by DICER

Massively parallel assays reveal a highly conserved sequence motif termed the GYM motif, which potentiates RNA interference by directing Dicer-mediated small RNA processing.

  • Young-Yoon Lee
  • Haedong Kim
  • V. Narry Kim
Article 22 Feb 2023
